The wave stays in the original medium

definitions.def: The change of direction of a wave at the boundary between two materials. The reflected wave bounces back into the original material.

secText: We use light to discuss reflection, although other waves such as water waves reflect as well. The mirror shown in the top illustration reflects light to form the woman’s image.

The Moon is visible in the lower photograph because light from the Sun reflected off the Moon into the camera. The light changed direction as it reached the Moon, starting in one direction, and moving in a different direction after striking the Moon’s surface.  Different areas of the Moon absorb and reflect different amounts and wavelengths of light, which causes the different shades and colors you see.
